metadata.title: CVE-2021-47511 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA:pcm: oss: Fix negative period/buffer sizes The period size calculation inOSS layer may receive a negative value as an error, but the code thereassumes only the positive values and handle them with size_t. Due to that,a too big value may be passed to the lower layers. This patch changes thecode to handle with ssize_t and adds the proper error checks appropriately.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47511` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1119-fips - 4.15.0-1119.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2103-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2103.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2082-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2082.88

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
